page.title: 08HARLOW SPORTSCENTRE
page.content: The first grant-aided{Sportscentre in{England}was opened in{Harlow}in 1960.It is unusual because the swimming pool is on another site.The main building has a two-court hall which can accomodate 2 full-sized courts for Netball,Basketball or 5 a side Football and 8 Badminton courts. The sprung floor is marked out clearly in different colours for each sport. There are 8 Squash courts one of which is glass fronted for spectators. There is also a weight training room, a Dojo for Judo,a Sauna suite,Table- tennis facilities,a Gymnastics pit and Trampolining.A creche enables parents to enjoy the facilities leaving their children in safety. Ten people interviewed living up to 26 miles away said they used the centre for fitness and relaxation.70% of the members came from the{Harlow District.
